fields_of_interest: Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, External Relations, Borders and Security
eu_initiatives: AIPR works with EU member states and institutions to assist in building capacity for the prevention of genocide and other atrocity crimes. This is done through educational and technical assistance programs, which EU member states participate in through out the year, as well as bi-lateral assistance programs to tackle policy gaps for mass atrocity prevention identified by member states.
organisation_name: Instytut Auschwitz Na Rzecz Pokoju I Pojednania (AIPR)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
relevant_communication:
1) The Raphael Lemkin Seminar for Genocide Prevention, Global Edition 
 
2) The Latin American Network for Genocide and Mass Atrocity Prevention  
 
3) AIPR's Africa Programs Department 
 
For more information on these programs please see the following links respectively: 
 
http://www.auschwitzinstitute.org/lemkin-global-gov/ 
 
http://www.auschwitzinstitute.org/latin-american-network-for-genocide-and-mass-atrocity-prevention/ 
 
http://www.auschwitzinstitute.org/what-we-do/africa-programs/
goals__remit: AIPR is building a world that prevents genocide and other mass atrocities. Through education, training, and technical assistance, we support States to develop or strengthen policies and practices for the prevention of genocide and other mass atrocities. We also encourage and support the cooperation of States through regional and international networks to advance prevention.
